alert.note: Alert for Goshen; Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 4:58PM MDT until July 28 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... North central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 457 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles southeast of Chugwater, or 31 miles north of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Goshen, north central Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
